entities.description: A weighted logistic regression model for predicting serious mental illness (SMI) in the population.
Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration, responsible for overseeing and making adjustments to models and survey methodologies based on clinical data.
Clinical data collected from the Mental Health Surveillance Study from the years 2008 to 2012.
The diagnosis of serious mental illness identified during clinical interviews.
The diagnosis of any mental illness identified during clinical interviews.
Participants in the Mental Health Surveillance Study clinical interviews.
World Health Organization Disability Assessment Schedule used as an abbreviated assessment tool.
The NSDUH survey conducted in the year 2008.
The NSDUH survey conducted in the year 2012.
The language in which the survey was taken, which is English for the mentioned participants.
A vector of variables used in the weighted logistic regression model for prediction.
The estimated probability of a response being positive for SMI in the logistic regression model.
An age-related variable added to the prediction model to reduce bias and improve prediction.

relationships.description: The SMI weighted logistic regression model uses clinical data collected from MHSS.
SAMHSA oversees and makes adjustments to the SMI weighted logistic regression model.
The logistic regression model predicts the likelihood of an SMI diagnosis.
The logistic regression model also includes predictions for any mental illness diagnosis (AMI).
MHSS respondents provide the data used in the clinical data collection.
WHODAS is used to assess a subset of respondents.
The 2008 survey year includes specific MHSS respondents.
The 2012 survey year includes specific MHSS respondents.
The survey was administered in English to the respondents.
Explanatory variables are included in the weighted logistic regression model for predicting SMI.
Response probability is estimated by the logistic regression model.
An age variable is included in the prediction model to enhance accuracy.
